definition: broken/damaged/worn out/lousy/rotten/to break, split or cleave/to get rid of/to destroy/to break with/to defeat/to capture (a city etc)/to expose the truth of
to burst open/to split at the seam
(of an argument, theory etc) full of flaws (idiom)
to feign an opening in order to hoodwink the opponent (in a fight, combat etc)

sentences.english: His remark is full of contradictions and flaws.
sentences.chinese: 他的話前後矛盾，破綻百出。

sentences.english: The nail perforated her coat and left an ugly rip.
sentences.chinese: 釘子穿透她的上衣，留下一塊難看的破綻。

sentences.english: For the first time her veneer of politeness began to crack.
sentences.chinese: 她溫文爾雅的外表第一次露出破綻。

sentences.english: And the hand without any flaw.
sentences.chinese: 而且手上沒有任何破綻。

sentences.english: If they attack, concentrate your forces and attack his weakness.
sentences.chinese: 如果敵人進攻，就集中兵力看準敵人的破綻去打擊它。

sentences.english: Another similar expression is "showing the fox's tail", meaning let the cat out of bag, or give the game away.
sentences.chinese: 這就跟說“露出了狐狸尾巴”一樣，表示露出了破綻。

sentences.english: The robber gave himself away by spending so much money.
sentences.chinese: 那盜賊揮霍金銀，露出了破綻。

sentences.english: But, finally will actually expose weaknesses.
The witness tripped up rather badly under close cross-examination.
sentences.chinese: 這個證人在嚴密的交叉盤問之下破綻百出。

sentences.english: The interviewer tried to trip me up with his questions.
sentences.chinese: 採訪人員想用他的問題使我露出破綻。

sentences.english: Liu Han in the headquarters also found the flaw, timely judgment and retreat.
sentences.chinese: 而劉漢在司令部外也發現了破綻，及時判斷並撤退。

definition: to comment/to talk about/to discuss/discussion/CL:個|个[ge4]
suspense in a movie, play etc/concern for sb's welfare
to believe (sth in relation to oneself)/to regard oneself as/to acknowledge (sth in relation to oneself)/to resign oneself to
